article.headline: Southern Utah 88, Western Montana 70
article.story: CEDAR CITY, Utah (AP) -- DeAngelo Newsom scored 16 points to lead Southern Utah over Montana Western 88-70 in the Thunderbirds' season-opener Friday. Southern Utah's Steve Barnes went 6-for-6 from the field and scored 15 points. Curtis Lincoln added 14 points, and Tim Gainey had 10 points and 7 rebounds. Matt Luedtke led the NAIA Bulldogs (6-2) with 22 points, all in the first half. Bo Segeberg had 14 points and 8 rebounds, and Tyler Palmer added 13 points. After hitting two jumpers in the key and layup, Newsom finished a fast break with a dunk to give the Thunderbirds a 71-51 lead with 7:47 remaining. Gainey's 3-pointer from the left wing staked Southern Utah to its biggest lead, 76-55, with 6:26 left. After struggling offensively in the first half, Southern Utah shot 65 percent from the field in the second half. Montana Western dominated the sluggish T-Birds for most of the first half. Luedtke hit three straight 3-pointers and two free throws, giving the Bulldogs a 32-22 lead with 4:07 to play in the first half. Southern Utah tied it with a 10-0 run and took the lead 38-37 on Gainey's 3-pointer with 36 seconds left in the half.
